thread.title_full: Quebec City mosque shooting: vigils being held across Greater Toronto Area - Toronto | Globalnews.ca

author: Nick Westoll
title: Quebec City mosque shooting: vigils being held across Greater Toronto Area - Toronto | Globalnews.ca
text:
Quebec Shooting: Vigil on Gould Street near Ryerson University in downtown Toronto between 6:30 and 9 p.m. Candlelight walk by Coxwell Avenue and Gerrard Street E. in east-end Toronto between 7:45 and 9 p.m. 
Toronto officials and institutions have been reacting to the shooting throughout the day. 
Mayor John Tory released a statement on Monday, calling the attack an “unspeakable tragedy” and urging everyone to “reject all acts of fear, hatred and violence.” 
“Islamophobia and acts of hatred and violence against any group have no place in Toronto, and I ask the people of Toronto to come together to support our Muslim citizens and Canadians of all faiths and backgrounds,” Tory said. 
David Shum contributed to this report. © 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
